alert.note: Alert for Phillips (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 02 at 10:20PM CST until January 02 at 11:00PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Phillips County in eastern Arkansas... Southwestern Coahoma County in northwestern Mississippi... * Until 1100 PM CST. * At 1020 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles west of De Witt to near Merrisach Lake to near Lucca Landing, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Clarksdale, Marvell, Elaine, White River National Wildlife Refuge, Friars Point, Sherard, Crumrod, Watkins Corner, Lake View, Rena Lara, Mosby Spur, Ferguson, Counts, Wabash, Modoc, Hoop Spur, Westover, Beverly, Turkey Scratch and Ratio. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for eastern Arkansas...and northwestern Mississippi. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for eastern Arkansas...and northwestern Mississippi.
